body: @mycFelix Could u check whether you install heron in a system directory requiring sudo permission? Normally we install heron in user home dir.

@maosongfu - hi

I installed Heron command is following:

```
sudo ./home/hdfs/heron-install/heron-client-install-0.14.1-centos.sh
```

```
[hdfs ~]$ which heron
/usr/local/bin/heron
```

And the $HERON_HOME is : 

```
[hdfs ~]$ ll /usr/local/heron/
total 28
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan   1 1970 bin
drwxr-xr-x 6 root root 4096 Jan   1 1970 conf
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan   1 1970 dist
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan  19 14:32 etc
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan   1 1970 examples
drwxr-xr-x 7 root root 4096 Jan   1 1970 lib
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root  280 Jan   1 1970 release.yaml
```

Is this right...?

You don't need sudo; instead I think you should:
$ ./heron-client-install-VERSION-PLATFORM.sh --user

I tried,but failed. That's why i write an issue.

I installed Heron using following command on `hdfs` or `miaoyichen` user accont:

```
./home/hdfs/heron-install/heron-client-install-0.14.1-centos.sh --user 
```

I got an error about '/home/.pex' when the topo tried to start heron-shell.

@ashvina told me that it was a problem about the `non admin user accounts` yesterday. But I've followed the guide,but failed too.

@maosongfu - more details

There are part of logs after i submited a topo:

```
‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
```

The last log I got is `Closing the tunnel processes` . The program seems to have hung up and wait for some signal to close, even all the executor has been killed.

```
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, mode)

2016-07-19 15:56:05: heron-shell-1 exited too many times
2016-07-19 15:56:05: Executor terminated; exiting all process in executor.

```

Hi @kramasamy  
Sorry for late reply... thank you for your patience and helpful feedbacks. 

Now this built well on my local machine (that is Ubuntu 14.04), 
Could you please have a try `docker build` on your mac os ?
If any problem still exists, tell me , I wll keep tracking down :)

@caofangkun - I ran with the docker file and I am getting the following error.

```
checking for C compiler default output file name... 
configure: error: in `/gcc-4.8.2':
configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
See `config.log' for more details.
The command '/bin/sh -c tar -zxvf gcc-4.8.2.tar.gz     && cd gcc-4.8.2      && tar -zxvf ../mpc-1.0.1.tar.gz && tar -jxvf ../mpfr-3.1.4.tar.bz2     && tar -jxvf ../gmp-5.1.3.tar.bz2 && tar -jxvf ../isl-0.11.1.tar.bz2     && tar -zxvf ../cloog-0.18.0.tar.gz     && mv mpc-1.0.1  mpc && mv mpfr-3.1.4 mpfr && mv gmp-5.1.3 gmp && mv isl-0.11.1 isl     && mv cloog-0.18.0 cloog     && ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/gcc' returned a non-zero code: 77
Cleaning up scratch dir
```

Just left a small naming nit, but changes LGTM if @nlu90 and @maosongfu don't have add'l comments.

@mycFelix The Heron client uses REEF client to submit the topology. The REEF library is waiting for some internal events. I am working on that issue with the REEF team. However the wait does not cause topology submission failure. Please ignore that for now.
They run if I explicitly add `--experimental_action_listener=tools/java:compile_java` but not otherwise
@kramasamy @billonahill I think I have addressed all your comments. Please let me know how the doc looks like now.
@avflor - looks good to me. @billonahill - let us know if this is ok to go.
@kramasamy Can you have a look at this PR?
üëç
looks good - ship it.
@caofangkun How is the ShellBolt support going on? If you need any help, please let us know.
@ashvina Thanks you very much. I'll do some other tests on YARN mode.

Hi @mycFelix, I am also looking at the permission denied error. In my test the user submitting the topology was also a user on YARN cluster and existed on all YARN nodes. I do not get the error. Does that work for you?

Hi @ashvina , I can run mapreduce or spark job on our Yarn cluster using `hdfs` or `miaoyichen` user. 

I tried it again using `hdfs` user. The topo was running correctly and metrics info was showed on UI. I do have the log-files,one of container's log is following:

```
[hdfs@CDM1C10-209019142 log-files]$ tail container_1_exclaim1_1.log.0
[2016-07-20 10:43:08 +0800] stdout STDOUT:  Bolt processed 123700000 tuples in 88031 ms
```

But I failed to open every instance's log&job page,and `all executor terminated` after running a while,maybe tens of minutes, cause the heron-shell didn't  started.
@objmagic @nlu90

@caofangkun 

Thanks a lot! @nlu90 and I will review this tomorrow.

Hi,

We had a discussion a long time ago and we decided to use only java.util.logging within heron code base. The existence of any other logging libraries is for other 3rd party libraries that heron uses.

Here are steps for trying mesos scheduler locally:
- Install heron by building latest master from the scratch(The release version does not contain mesos scheduler)
  bazel run ‚Äîconfig=darwin ‚Äîverbose_failures ‚Äî scripts/packages:heron-client-install.sh ‚Äîuser
1. Install mesos locally
   https://mesosphere.com/blog/2014/07/07/installing-mesos-on-your-mac-with-homebrew/
2. Change the config in heron/config/src/yaml/conf/mesos/scheduler.yaml
   "heron.mesos.native.library.path" to the dir you mesos installed in step 1
3. Play with mesos scheduler
   heron submit mesos ‚Äîverbose ~/.heron/examples/heron-examples.jar com.twitter.heron.examples.ExclamationTopology ExclamationTopology
   heron kill mesos ExclamationTopology

Thanks @mycFelix 
I don't think there is anything wrong with the YARN clusters. This is specific to Heron components on the YARN nodes, https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/website/content/docs/operators/heron-shell.md. 

@maosongfu In case heron-shell is not needed/used, can it be disabled? Or at least temporarily.
Have you noticed the permission error on Aurora clusters?

@ashvina yes when people try to install heron in system dir requiring sudo permission, heron will try to do some temp work in HERON_HOME, which is also in system dir potentially requiring sudo permission. May need to think a way to handle it. There are no simple ways to disable heron-shell unless changing the source code and re-build a new release.

Thank @ashvina and @maosongfu AGAIN!

The situation is I installed Heron using `hdfs` user which is not admin user account following  @maosongfu 's guide. `hdfs` user's $HOME and $HERON_HOME is following:

```
[hdfs@CDM1C10-209019142 ~]$ echo $HOME
/home/hdfs
[hdfs@CDM1C10-209019142 ~]$ echo $HERON_HOME
/home/hdfs/.heron
```

But It seems what Heron-shell finds is `/home/.pex`,following `heron-executor.stdout` logs:

```
pex/common.py", line 103, in safe_mkdir
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, mode)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, mode)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, mode)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, mode)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/os.py", line 157, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/home/.pex'
```

So the Heron-shell failed to start. 

I think that maybe `$HOME/.pex`,means `/home/hdfs/.pex`,  is the right path should be found by Heron-shell,not `/home/.pex`.

@maosongfu @ashvina  - one more basic question.

Do i need to install heron on each node of our cluster using same user account,or just one node to be a client?

Heron has multiple Config classes so if we're going to rename them we should consider the names of all of them:

```
com.twitter.heron.{api,spi.common,common.config}.Config
```

@cliffyg - thanks for the pull request. Since it is the first time you are issuing a pull request - can you sign the CLA form? It is pretty straightforward and entirely can be done on the web.

https://engineering.twitter.com/opensource/cla
can we call this packer itself instead of package? the external tool that will be shipped will be called `heron-packer`
@nlu90 - can you please add several unit tests?
If the change is for the underlying Heron API - we should change it across all the class as @billonahill pointed out.
@caofangkun - this is great. One broad comment is we need to retain the copyright information of Storm files.
@ashvina - Can you help review the PR?
Also I don't think it makes sense for them to all be renamed to HeronConfig. Either they stay as a gerenric Config class with package context, or they get renamed so each implies their scope.
@kramasamy sure will add the documentation.
@supunkamburugamuve - please use the documentation format like we have for other uploaders to ensure consistency.
I reviewed this PR yesterday. It looks good to me.
Thanks @objmagic. @kramasamy added the documentation.
@mycFelix No. Heron client installation is needed on one node only. The client will package the required bits and provide to RM.
üëç
not sure why no CI is running...
@kramasamy I've signed the form

LGTM üëç 

If possible add a test for config verification.
added pull request https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1119
@cliffyg - thanks. merging the fix in. thanks for the contribution.

@kramasamy I refactored the code and added many comments.

I'll add unit test in the next commit
üëç  once the cpu and disk issue is filed and comments are added
Added a test for configuration.

@zhangzhonglai hi, I encountered the same problem about `the pex get an incorrect $HOME env for yarn user` on Yarn mode. 
Have you found a way to solve it or a correct configuration to make it right?
Please add unit tests. Are you planning in the next PR or this PR?
@nlu90 and @maosongfu is this good to go?

Hi @billonahill 
What about the following changes ?
1.  rename `com.twitter.heron.api.Config` to `com.twitter.heron.api.HeronConfig`
2. rename `com.twitter.heron.common.config.Config`  to `com.twitter.heron.common.config.CommonConfig` 
3. rename `com.twitter.heron.spi.common.Config` to  `com.twitter.heron.spi.common.SpiCommonConfig`
@kramasamy LGTM
@kramasamy unit tests for LocalBlobstore and LocalMetastore are added

@mycFelix Hi, I think there is a bit of difference between my problem with yours. My problem maybe encountered before the point of yours. Following is the error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):

    makedirs(head, mode)

    mkdir(name, mode)
OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/home/.pex/install'
```

My problem occurred when the pex is installing. So the error message will not exist in heron_executor.stdout. Because the heron_executor command can't run and the `heron_executor.stdout` file is not exist in path.
In your case, your problem occurred after the pex installed. Can you find the `.pex` directory in the yarn working directory?
I guess this problem maybe a system-dependent issue or config-dependent issue with python or pex. But I have no time to deal with the problem. 
Sorry, I have no idea of the problem for now.
@zhangzhonglai - Hi, thank you for your reply and helpful detail informations. I will review my configuration again and do more tests.
in tools/bazel.rc, I see darwin config enables check styles but not sure why it does not enforce it.

For the license issue, since many code in the heron/storm directory is borrowed from Storm project, we need to respect the original license from Storm project. 

As we updated the license in #1080, please retain the original license.
@objmagic - is this completed?
@avflor - is this complete? if it is, please close this.
@cckellogg - can you take a look at this issue?

closing since the issue seems to have been resolved.

@windie - would you be interested in taking a look at this?
@caofangkun - if check style is an issue due to copyright, please update your branch from the master.
Thank you @kramasamy ,  the branch is already up to date.
@windie - curious to know what caused this issue.
@maosongfu  your link about _guarantees message processing_ work just on Storm not heron!!!
@kramasamy (or others), what's the reason for both spi Config and common Config? Can these be consolidated? Looks at the javadocs for the two classes it's not clear the distinction between the two.

We provide the same guarantees as storm - at least once and at most once.

Cheers
/Karthik

@mhajibaba Sorry I think I haven't explained clearly. Heron has compatible-api with storm and provides same guarantees as storm, so concept is shared and you can use heron acking mechanism as storm's.
completed. close now.

I'm reviewing the patch. It seems that theses code are almost the same as in storm. I noticed you removed `handleMetrics` from `ShellBolt.java`. What's the purpose? Instead of a PR with no context or explanation provided, could you please list all the differences so that we can have a better review of this patch?

Hi @maosongfu. I am looking at `AuroraLauncher`. It uses `Scheduler` as a library [ref](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/schedulers/src/java/com/twitter/heron/scheduler/aurora/AuroraLauncher.java#L48). Which means scheduler is not needed by topology master or instances and hence there will be no issues if YARN scheduler keeps the TMaster in a different container.
@objmagic - are we adding a verbose option? or it is going to be in a later PR?
It already has a verbose option, and it works fine.

@kramasamy - E.g., the following command fails

```
$ export CFLAGS=-I /usr/local/include/
-bash: export: `/usr/local/include/': not a valid identifier
```

I found this one when building heron in homebrew environment which sets CFLAGS and other similar environment variables.

In addition, right now I could not build heron using homebrew's bazel. Bazel just crashes with a useless error info: `ERROR: Process exited with status 1.`. Still investigating the cause.
@kramasamy - I think you meant `Window`? Sure. I will take a look.

@windie - we have not tried with homebrew environment actually. Since the bazel files are self sufficient, there is no need to use CFLAGS etc. In fact, I would advice to try it out without setting any of the CFLAGS, CXXFLAGS, etc
our current master works with both bazel 0.3.0 and bazel 0.2.3.
@windie - this is to support time windows - tumbling window, moving window, etc. it will be awesome, if you could help.

@chris-pardy @kramasamy Thanks for heads up, the 'heron-spi.jar' artifact uploaded to Maven Central is generated by the Heron release script.  We will need to check the release process to include the IUploader file.  I'm discussing with Karthik to resolve, thanks.

üëç

I just looked into the spi-jar genrule, only files in `utils` and `common` are included in the spi jar.

```
java_binary(
    name = "spi-unshaded",
    srcs = glob([
        "**/spi/utils/**/*.java",
        "**/spi/common/**/*.java",
    ]),
    deps = utils_deps_files,
)

genrule(
    name = "heron-spi-jar",
    srcs = [":spi-unshaded_deploy.jar"],
    outs = ["heron-spi.jar"],
    cmd  = "cp $< $@",
)
```
The original change is made in #937
